renderedFields.customfield_10031:
- Able to delete enrollments from UI
- Able to delete memberships to delete enrollments from UI
renderedFields.description: Currently, we do not have the ability to delete enrollments from UI. This feature would be useful especially when we start creating DRAFT enrollments and also if we need to clean up OLD enrollments in Sandbox. This could either be solved by having a way to delete membership and enrollment from either EPAdmin/EPOperation or EPManager.

comments.body:
• there is an endpoint to delete an enrollment
  • we don't know if manager can access it, or if it works
  • delete button only visible for draft enrollment
  • backend only allows deleting for draft enrollment

Please make this a lower priority than rest of SFDC stories & 429. We wouln’t want to “delete” enrollment for sellers who were once active, it will be more like a “de-activate” to not lose a record of their activity.

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

- Able to delete memberships to delete enrollments from UI

fields.description: Currently, we do not have the ability to delete enrollments from UI. This feature would be useful especially when we start creating DRAFT enrollments and also if we need to clean up OLD enrollments in Sandbox. This could either be solved by having a way to delete membership and enrollment from either EPAdmin/EPOperation or EPManager.

comments.body:
* there is an endpoint to delete an enrollment
* we don't know if manager can access it, or if it works
* delete button only visible for draft enrollment
* backend only allows deleting for draft enrollment

Please make this a lower priority than rest of SFDC stories & 429. We wouln’t want to “delete” enrollment for sellers who were once active, it will be more like a “de-activate” to not lose a record of their activity.

• only do the minimum necessary to fix

fix in sep

renderedFields.description:
In EPManager, when creating or editing an enrollment for RF, there are two file upload fields. These are Seller Bank Account Verification Document and Seller Standard Payment Terms (Optional). When no file has been uploaded, a user is able to successfully attach a file. However, once you attach a file, you are unable to replace that file which has already been attached. If a user were to accidentally select the wrong file, the user would be unable to replace the file by selecting the correct one.

The fields referred to above are in the attached image.

comments.body: Fix in september

issuetype.description: A problem or error.
issuetype.name: Bug

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
In EPManager, when creating or editing an enrollment for RF, there are two file upload fields. These are *Seller Bank Account Verification Document* and *Seller Standard Payment Terms (Optional)*. When no file has been uploaded, a user is able to successfully attach a file. However, once you attach a file, you are unable to replace that file which has already been attached. If a user were to accidentally select the wrong file, the user would be unable to replace the file by selecting the correct one. 

The fields referred to above are in the attached image.
fields.summary: Unable to modify file uploads in EPManager create/edit enrollment form for RF

comments.body: Fix in september
add isPresent and understand what the implications are

An example of this is "FIRST NAME".
This field has the following validation: "Only letters, spaces and - ' ."

However if the form is prepopulated with "User 1", it causes the form to be invalid so that the continue button is greyed out, but the red text showing the validation hint does not appear

looks like this is a solution: https://github.com/formium/formik/issues/1950

renderedFields.description:
Background: Google Maps API could be an easier and more accurate way to collect address information for suppliers. This spike is to investigate the google maps API and see how we could incorporate it into the address field.

AC:
Spend 1/2-1 day looking at the API
Come back with recs about how we can use this instead of our current address collection process

renderedFields.description:
The Admin API call to create users creates users successfully. The user list in the enrollment object continues to contain unique users.
The EPManager API call to create users creates duplicate users. The user list in the enrollment object gets duplicate users.

1. Create an RF enrollment and add a user.
2. Save the enrollment as a draft
3. Go back to the enrollment and add the same user.
4. Save the enrollment again.
5. Inspect the user list in the "onboarding" object and note that there are duplicate users.

issuetype.description: A problem or error.
issuetype.name: Bug

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description:
The Admin API call to create users creates users successfully. The user list in the enrollment object continues to contain unique users.
The EPManager API call to create users creates duplicate users. The user list in the enrollment  object gets duplicate users.

1. Create an RF enrollment and add a user.
2. Save the enrollment as a draft
3. Go back to the enrollment and add the same user.
4. Save the enrollment again.
5. Inspect the user list in the "onboarding" object and note that there are duplicate users.
fields.summary: Duplicate Users Can be created with two different API calls

renderedFields.description:
If your project has a large number of tests, it can take a long time for tests to complete running serially on one machine. Running tests in parallel across many virtual machines can save your team time and money when running tests in Continuous Integration (CI).

Cypress can run recorded tests in parallel across multiple machines since version 3.1.0. While parallel tests can also technically run on a single machine, we do not recommend it since this machine would require significant resources to run your tests efficiently.

https://docs.cypress.io/guides/guides/parallelization.html#Overview

issuetype.description: A small, distinct piece of work.
issuetype.name: Task

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

Map the CSV to the enrollment record

Create enrollment for each supplier

Make the name associated with the upload the admin on the account

Make the supplier active
renderedFields.description:
Background: Specific for the HSBC deal with Schaeffler, but will be relevant for other deals with numerous suppliers. This feature will allow an Ops or Support user (eventually also bank or buyer user) to upload a CSV with multiple suppliers and have that create an enrollment and membership for them. This will sit in the Ops App.

When the supplier’s are uploaded into the system, this should create a supplier enrollment record and membership. We will only be getting files with suppliers that are fully ready to go (KYCed, onboarded to bank, bank account has been changed by the buyer), so when it is uploaded the supplier is ready to start.

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

fields.customfield_10031:
Map the CSV to the enrollment record

Create enrollment for each supplier

Make the name associated with the upload the admin on the account

Make the supplier active

renderedFields.description: Currently, for local development, we are heavily dependent on cloud stacks for e2e testing. As part of the company-wide efforts to move away from using cloud stack, we need to get ready to move away from it and use a earlypayments mock environment instead. This epic encapsulates all the stories necessary to start using a mock environment for the enrollment team.

comments.body: Benefit: Removal of dependency on cloudstacks will allow us to move way faster. Higher quality due to automated testing.

renderedFields.description:
Why do we need Component tests?

  • We want to test the API and validate its response
  • Every API’s response is a contract with its caller which must not be broken. If changed, it must always be backward compatible
  • It basically tests the Controller layer of the backend

What do we have today?

  • We have Controller tests today but they are not consistent.
  • Some Controller tests load the full Spring context which makes the tests very slow and increases build time.
  • Some tests extend JerseyControllerTest and are pretty fast but they start a Grizzly server and can’t run in parallel

What do we need to do?

  • All the Controller tests must be moved to the Component test section of the test-suite
  • It will decrease the build time significantly
  • It will enforce the contract during build time

issuetype.description: A big user story that needs to be broken down. Created by Jira Software - do not edit or delete.
issuetype.name: Epic

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

status.description: This issue is being actively worked on at the moment by the assignee.
status.name: In Progress

* We want to test the API and validate its response
* Every API’s response is a contract with its caller which must not be broken. If changed, it must always be backward compatible
* It basically tests the Controller layer of the backend

What do we have today?

* We have Controller tests today but they are not consistent.
* Some Controller tests load the full Spring context which makes the tests very slow and increases build time.
* Some tests extend JerseyControllerTest and are pretty fast but they start a Grizzly server and can’t run in parallel

What do we need to do?

* All the Controller tests must be moved to the Component test section of the test-suite
* It will decrease the build time significantly
* It will enforce the contract during build time
fields.summary: Component Tests

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
- a `supplierChargeRate` column exists that is combination of spread rate and network rate in SCF, `rate` in DD, and `sellerFlatRate` in RF.
- Updating the `supplierChargeRate` should update `rate` in DD
- Updating the `supplierChargeRate` should update `sellerFlatRate` in RF
- Updating the `supplierChargeRate` in SCF should update related fields (network spread rate, provider spread rate, etc.)
renderedFields.description:
SCF - Interest rates is the sum of provider spread rate and network spread rate

DD - Interest rate is represented by the {{rate}}column

RF - Interest rate is represented by the sellerFlatRate column

The concept is the same but the interest rates are represented by 3 different rates in 3 different products. They should be consistent so that whichever component outside of membership (UI, other services) is interested in the interest rate, would go to one single field to do that.

This is also important from the modularization point of view because you would not the logic of product specific rate columns to creep outside of membership, especially if you are sending a change event in case of a microservice.

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

- Updating the `supplierChargeRate` should update `sellerFlatRate` in RF
- Updating the `supplierChargeRate` in SCF should update related fields (network spread rate, provider spread rate, etc.)

fields.description:

DD - Interest rate is represented by the {{rate}}column

RF - Interest rate is represented by the {{sellerFlatRate}} column

The concept is the same but the interest rates are represented by 3 different rates in 3 different products. They should be consistent so that whichever component outside of membership (UI, other services) is interested in the interest rate, would go to one single field to do that.

This is also important from the modularization point of view because you would not the logic of product specific rate columns to creep outside of membership, especially if you are sending a change event in case of a microservice.
fields.summary: Interest rates fields need to be consistent

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
- Create feature keys in Flagr administration suite for use on sandbox and production
- Create a node service that takes a unique feature key and returns a feature flag object.
- Refactor and transition EPManager, EPOperations, and EPSupplier from call to EarlyPayments to new API request call
- Node endpoint uses Tradeshift checkr/jsFlagr
- Feature is well documented.

renderedFields.customfield_10031: PDFs types can be determined programmatically by IEP
renderedFields.description:
Current the Seller PDFs are all added to the attachments & files slot in the Opportunity. This ticket is modify the Opportunity workflow so that each PDF is stored separately or tagged in some way so that IEP will be able to know which PDF is which without user intervention.

We should work with accountid:5cfec89eceb3f20bc3b2bbed, accountid:5abe920ee56ac41fbdc2df97, accountid:5d570ecba1f3290c16e66ea5 or someone they recommend to achieve this.

comments.body: Also, please check the whenever we update Salesforce of a particular attachment type, how do we manage those files

Vijay says there is only one document right now, so we can assume the document type is enrollment letter.

can assume the first one is enrollment letter, later ones are additional document.

we are flexible on how to handle multiple documents, suggest something else if it works better during development.
on hold because of salesforce bug

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
Check if RD-277 is a duplicate, if not then...

For the enrollment UIs:
- Remove the exception if possible, otherwise...
- Ensure all exceptions are now correctly reported in sentry for the missing 4xx errors
- Ensure all sentry issues have clear information which can be used to debug the issue
renderedFields.description:
A PR for the backend was merged that will take care of all of the 4xx false positives that we have been seeing (for all the teams). Any errors now in the backend will be MUST fix issues.

Frontend - The errors are now moved from the backend to the frontend, where the user should not be allowed to have a path now that would fire this error and should be captured somehow in the frontend. The frontend needs the ability to validate these errors and improve the UX experience.

There are some errors reported in sentry that has very little context - bad request is not enough information (specifically the ones coming from the frontend)

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

renderedFields.description:
Background: For credit protection we have to put in place limits for invoices that we fund for suppliers. There will be three types of credit limits:

  • Single Invoice Limit - largest dollar amount that we would fund off one invoice
  • Pre Approval Invoice Limit - largest invoice size we would fund pre-approval
  • Overall Credit Limit - Maximum aggregate exposure we would have to a supplier at any one time.

Acceptance Criteria:

  • Once the information has been received from Aronova (EN-261)
  • Display them in the Receivables Purchase Agreement or enrollment form to the supplier before they sign it.

comments.body: Discussed - still in flux/ not sure where we will display to the supplier.

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

* Overall Credit Limit - Maximum aggregate exposure we would have to a supplier at any one time.

*Acceptance Criteria:*

* Display them in the Receivables Purchase Agreement or enrollment form to the supplier before they sign it.

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
- All references of contactName should be removed
- First name and last name data should be populated as part of migration from contactName
renderedFields.description:
Remove contactName and use contactFirstName and contactLastName and update the references from both frontend and backend.

Right now in IEP we store Seller contact name , contact first name and contact last name in seperately. The idea is to remove the contact name (as the full name is not necessarily firstname + lastname, need to be decided on contextual basis) and add a migration to fill contact first name and contact last name from seller profile if required

Background: We need an easy way for sales to demo our enrollment flow to a prospect. Then have it go back to the beginning of the process

AC:

  • Click into the invite enrollment
  • See the data entry screen and input data
  • See and enter docs in the document screen
  • See the documentation screen and be able to finish the enrollment
  • Once enrollment is completed, reset to the INVITED state

renderedFields.description:
Background: Companies House is the UK gov’t database of all their companies financials and corporate info. If there is good consistent data in the API we could use just the Companies House number to do all underwriting in the UK as well as verify supplier info.

User Value: Instead of having to produce multiple documents for TS a supplier can just provide their companies house number.

Look into Companies House API documentation and sandbox environment to see if the use case works for us.

Acceptance Criteria:

Make an account

Pull out data from dummy account

Recommendation as to if it is useful or not

https://developer-specs.companieshouse.gov.uk/guides/gettingStarted

issuetype.name: Story

renderedFields.description: Oh no! Due to a programming error, cases don't get moved to completed. To fix this, a developer will need to remove the AwaitingRfTermsOfService handler and instead have the CaseConfigurator go straight to Completed. Completed's promotion will write the audit record and call it a day. We don't need the code in AwaitingRfTermsOfService because there's no scenario where a user would have started an enrollment without having accepted the tradeshift terms of service (the point of having this handler in the first place). If the team wants to keep the handler around, then at the minimum the AwaitingRfTermsOfService handler should call the promote method of the completed handler instead of manually setting the status of the enrollment (`onboarding.setStatus(OnboardingStatus.COMPLETED)`)

comments.body: accountid:5e14bc9fefa19b0e976b7a64 please check if all other enrollments are broken in the same way and close this ticket if so.

issuetype.description: A problem or error.
issuetype.name: Bug

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.description: Oh no! Due to a programming error, cases don't get moved to completed. To fix this, a developer will need to remove the AwaitingRfTermsOfService handler and instead have the CaseConfigurator go straight to Completed. Completed's promotion will write the audit record and call it a day. We don't need the code in AwaitingRfTermsOfService because there's no scenario where a user would have started an enrollment without having accepted the tradeshift terms of service (the point of having this handler in the first place). If the team wants to keep the handler around, then at the minimum the AwaitingRfTermsOfService handler should call the promote method of the completed handler instead of manually setting the status of the enrollment (`onboarding.setStatus(OnboardingStatus.COMPLETED)`)
fields.summary: Enrollment cases end up in AwaitingTermsOfService instead of Completed

renderedFields.customfield_10031:
AC:

Diagram like the above for enrollment domain as it exists today as an FSM (finite state machine), minus all exception cases, just the main states and events

Review of a plan for how it will look in the future, including the changes to the FSM above, as a separate domain module(s) and data model

Ensure there are no circular dependencies and we have asynchronous communication.

Plan to implement this as close to code as possible - we should be able to read the machine in the code

Map the new state machine to what is proposed as “status flows” from our program
renderedFields.description:
Right now we do not have a clear definition of the events and states that will be needed in enrollment to align with our business and technical strategy. It would be a huge benefit to have these documents to talk from.

We have an example in FIS that was done to help foster communication (although it was done a bit too late to be useful enough).

This is what we need to do for the enrollment part of IEP - both what we plan to do in the future for modularization and what exists today.

renderedFields.description:
Background: Plaid can provide us with bank account balances which could help underwriting and timing of when a supplier needs working capital.

User Value: Instead of having to produce audited financials which I may or may not even have as a supplier I can enble Tradeshift to automatically underwrite my credit via Plaid.

When the user inputs their bank account information
Backend will access Plaid
And return bank account balances

Need to create endpoints for the Plaid API to do this

https://plaid.com/docs/#balance

Acceptance Criteria

  • Create endpoint to draw out bank account balances daily for last 2 years
  • Save these in IEP and attach to supplier profile

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story

nonEditableReason.message: The Parent Link is only available to Jira Premium users.

fields.summary: End points for Balances

renderedFields.description:
When the user inputs their bank account information
Backend will access Plaid
And return transaction history

Need to create endpoints for the Plaid API to do this

https://plaid.com/docs/#transactions

Acceptance Criteria

  • Create endpoint to consume the transaction history
    • Amount
    • Debit or credit
    • Account (making or receiving the payment)
    • Date
  • Save these in IEP and attach to supplier profile

fields.summary: End points for transactions

renderedFields.description:
Background: Plaid provides endpoints for bank account numbers. This will allow us to pull relevant info for the payment routing.

User Value: As a user I can just provide Tradeshift my bank account log in rather than locate all of the bank account numbers myself.

When the user inputs their bank account information
Backend will access Plaid
And return bank account and routing numbers

Need to create endpoints for the Plaid API to do this

https://plaid.com/docs/#auth

Acceptance Criteria

  • Checking bank account number
  • Checking routing number
  • Savings bank account number
  • Savings routing number

Unsure if there will be a savings account as these are business accounts

  • No Data Storage!!!

issuetype.description: Functionality or a feature expressed as a user goal.
issuetype.name: Story
